channel.title: [317]Devolution source, mage trains range and range trains mage? help
channel.description: subject explains it all, in my source i have when i get a bow and arrows and train it gets up my magic levels, and when i cast spells training mage it trains my range, can someone help me here?

item.title: [317]Devolution source, mage trains range and range trains mage? help
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

After reading your post I looked through my old Devolution source. I assume that in using a 317 that you have a client.java (I only recently returned to the RSPS community to find all of these fancy client protocols that I’m still getting used to), if it does, search it for:

playerMagic

or

playerLevel[6]

If, in the line before that, there is

addSkillXP

Then the code is telling the server that when the above action is performed, magic experience is given. My guess is that that action would be something like this:

attackedNpc = true; attackedNpcId = attacknpc; double TotalExp = 0; if (!UseBow)

That’s basically saying that when you attack an npc, if you are using a bow, it will give you magic experience. Depending on how your code deals with levels, you could either change the experience giving code (because that should be easier) to:

playerRanged

or

playerLevel[4]

That should mean that attacking an NPC with a bow will give you ranged experience. That won’t do anything for PvP though, so what were you having the problem with?

The method for changing the ranged to magic experience will be identical, but in reverse. If that doesn’t solve your problem, of if you’re using a completely different source that doesn’t have any of this stuff, tell me and I’ll have a look at it.

Read full topic
item.source: [317]Devolution source, mage trains range and range trains mage? help
